thread.title: Inola, Verdigris look to beat the odds
thread.title_full: Inola, Verdigris look to beat the odds

title: Inola, Verdigris look to beat the odds
text:
Posted: 10:02 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 Inola, Verdigris look to beat the odds ﻿ View Larger JOEY JOHNSON Oologah's Jimmy McKinney (40) hurdles over Brendin Ballard (2) for a good run during high school football action between Glenpool at Oologah on September 18, 2015. Tulsa World Sponsored Links By Barry Lewis Tulsa World 
During the past decade, about 90 percent of the football teams that have started 0-2 in district play have failed to reach the playoffs. 
Class 3A Verdigris and Inola each have a reasonable chance of being included among the few teams that beat those odds. 
They play each other Friday at Inola, but that game won’t have any bearing on their playoff chances because they are in different districts. 
“We’re both kind of in the same boat,” Inola coach Jeff Williams said. “We both want to win, but we also both want to stay healthy. I would rather be in a full district where we play a district team every week at this time of the year , but under the circumstances, this comes at a pretty good time for us. Sign up for our FOX23 News This Morning Newsletter Sign Up
